nodes.text: First Order Walker Drivers were personnel that specialized in operating walkers such as the First Order All Terrain Armored Transport, All Terrain MegaCaliber Six, and the All Terrain Heavy Hauler during the war between the First Order and the Resistance. They wore armor similar to that of troopers of the Stormtrooper Corps, being distinguished by a gray stripe over their helmets.
First Order Walker Drivers were specialists who operated complex vehicles, including the All Terrain Heavy Hauler, the All Terrain MegaCaliber Six, and the First Order All Terrain Armored Transport.

The MegaCaliber Six was led by an officer who commanded one pilot and one gunner officer, both of whom were Walker Drivers who sat at their stations in the cockpit. Two Walker Drivers who served as weapons engineers were stationed in a space within the walker's main body that was near the MegaCaliber Six turbolaser cannon at the top, where one engineer managed a weapons diagnostics interface. The All Terrain Heavy Hauler was manned by four gunners wearing the armor of Walker Drivers, with two operating targeting interfaces at each side of the vehicle. A Walker Driver pilot and a co-pilot sat at the tug walker's bridge, where they were overseen by a vehicle commander. The cockpit of an All Terrain Armored Transport was occupied by two Walker Drivers.

Donning a gray jumpsuit, the walker crew at the Battle of Crait wore a helmet that resembled that of standard First Order stormtroopers. The right of the helmet's front bore a gray stripe. Some walker drivers wore an armor akin to that of snowtroopers, with the addition of a gray stripe over the right side of the helmet. All Terrain Armored Transport walker drivers aboard the Finalizer wore a armor set of armor with a helmet similar to that of a typical stormtrooper's, though the tip of the helmet's front bore a dark line that broadened in width as it came down the forehead.

In 34 ABY, First Order Walker Drivers manned All Terrain MegaCaliber Sixes and All Terrain Heavy Haulers in the Battle of Crait against the Resistance. The First Order forces won the battle on Crait under the leadership of Supreme Leader Kylo Ren, the walkers emerging victorious without casualties. Soon after, Ren's flagship, the Finalizer, captured a group of Resistance members over Batuu. As the Resistance members escaped towards the starship's escape pods, they encountered a vehicle bay containing All Terrain Armored Transports. Two Walker Drivers within one of the transports spotted the escaping rebels and activated the walker's laser cannons. However, the Resistance members evaded the shots and escaped to Batuu safely.

The First Order Walker Driver was first mentioned in the LEGO set "75189 First Order Heavy Assault Walker," released in 2017 as a tie-in to the sequel trilogy film released later in the same year, Star Wars: Episode VIII The Last Jedi. The drive appears in the Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge ride Star Wars: Rise of the Resistance.
